lines.gurmukhi: jYsy rwjw rvq Anyk rvnI shyq skl spUqI eyk bwNJ n sMqwn hY
lines.transliteration_english: Jaisay Raajaa Ravat Anayk Ravanee Sahayta , Sakal Sapootee Ayk Baanjh N Santaan Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as a king loves many queens who all bear him a son, but there may be one who is barren, who cannot bear any issue.

lines.gurmukhi: sIcq sill jYsy sPl skl dRum inhPl syNbl sill inrbwin hY
lines.transliteration_english: Seechat Salil Jaisay Sadhal Sakal Drouma , Nihadhal Saynbal Salil Nirabaani Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as irrigating the trees help them bear fruits but the cotton silk tree remains fruitless. It does not accept the influence of water.

lines.gurmukhi: dwdr kml jYsy eyk srvr ibKY auqm Aau nIc kIc idnkir iDAwn hY
lines.transliteration_english: Daadar Kamal Jaisay Ayk Saravar Bikhai , Outam Au Neech Keech Dinakari Dhiaan Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as a frog and a lotus flower live in one pond but lotus is supreme since it faces Sun and frog is low since it remains engrossed in mud.

lines.gurmukhi: qYsy gur crn srin hY skl jgu cMdn bnwspqI bwNs aunmwn hY ]519]
lines.transliteration_english: Taisay Gur Charan Sarani Hai Sakal Jagu , Chandan Banaasapatee Baans Ounamaan Hai ?519?

Shabad OS B.translation: Similarly the whole world comes into the refuge of the True Guru. Devoted Sikhs of the True Guru who expel sandalwood-like fragrance obtain the elixir-like Naam from Him and become fragrant too. But a bamboo-like arrogant, knotty and self wise person rema
